text.p: Collaborating to steal the spotlight from their biggest rival, Oracle Corp. and Netscape Communications Corp. will hold a press conference on Monday to discuss a broad alliance, the companies said.

The press conference will be to outline a collaboration by the companies on their products, a spokeswoman for Netscape said, declining to give specifics. Oracle officials couldn't immediately be reached to comment.
Part of the announcement will concentrate on the network computer, the cheap, easy-to-administer machines that Oracle, Netscape and Sun Microsystems Inc. hope will unseat the personal computer.
The Netscape and Oracle event will be held the same day Microsoft Corp. is expected to unveil its answer to the network computer: Specifications for a new class of low-maintenance PCs.

In recent weeks, Netscape and Oracle seperately have outlined product strategies that would make it easier for their customers -- traditionally, big corporations -- to tap vital business information stored in their databases.
The announcements on Monday will likely include agreements between the companies to share each other's products and technology, according to trade magazine Computer Reseller News.
Some of the technology could include software that enables network computers to search databases, it said.
